item.title: Fuckup: Programming Languages and Organizations
item.description: Some years ago I witnessed a fuckup which let to the creation of our Rules of Play and the need for a macro architecture and guidelines. In the early 2010 Scala as a functional programming language became very popular. We were a Java Shop with an occasional Groovy service. All JVM based. One team decided that they wanted to try out something new a went for Scala. It was cool, new features, functional, less boilerplate.
